descript.abstract: 2004-2013 Highway Safety Improvement Program Bicycle Crash Cluster Locations.Â This layer shows the top 5% of bicyclist crash clusters for each Regional Planning Agency between the years of 2004-2013.
descript.purpose: The top locations where reported collisions occurred between bicyclists and motor vehicles have been identified. The crash cluster analysis methodology for the top bicyclist clusters uses a fixed meter search distance of 100 meters (328 ft.) to merge crash clusters together. Located crashes between motor vehicles and bicyclists were identified by using the non-motorist type code within the CDS database (which may yield different results from using most harmful event, first harmful event, or sequence of events data fields). Furthermore, the methodology uses the Equivalent Property Damage Only (EPDO) weighting to rank the clusters. However, because of the relatively small number of reported bicyclist crashes in the crash data file, the clustering analysis used crashes from the ten year period from 2004-2013. Additionally, due to the larger geographic area encompassed by the bicyclist crash clusters, it was difficult to name them so they were left unnamed but can be viewed spatially.

idinfo.useconst: This data is in the public domain and therefore can be used by anyone for any purpose. MassDOT shall not be held liable for any errors in this data. This includes errors of omission, commission, errors concerning the content of the data, and relative and positional accuracy of the data. This data cannot be construed to be a legal document. Primary sources from which this data was compiled must be consulted for verification of information contained in this data.

attr.attrdef: Number of located bicyclist crashes within the cluster

enttyp.enttypd: Unique field generated in the cluster creation
Number of fatal crashes within the cluster
Number of property damage only crashes

attr.attrdef: Fatal crashes are assigned a weight of 10, injury crashes a weight of 5 and property damage only a weight of 1

enttyp.enttypd: Second longest street within the cluster
Second longest route within the cluster
Street with highest functional class within the cluster
Street with second highest functional class within the cluster
Route information for street with highest functional class within the cluster
Route information for street with second highest functional class within the cluster
Regional planning agency/agencies where the cluster is located
Town(s) where the cluster is located
MassDOT district(s) where the cluster is located
